Class ClubStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClubStats

  • public class ClubStats
extends java.lang.Object
    The ClubStats class provides methods which allows the user to add a new climber to a club, add details of a mountain to a climber, as well as view statistics about the club, all in a graphical way though printing this information to the console. Switch statements in the start method allow the user to navigate between these different options and will return them back to a menu when they have completed one. This class also contains the main method required to run the program
    Version:
    1.0 (08/11/2017)
    Author:
    (Michael Westerby)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addClimber()
      Allows the user to create a new Climber which will be added to the club by specifying their name, gender and age.
      void addMountain()
      Presents the user with a list of climbers (ordered by their index value in the climber list array) so they can select which one they would like to add a new mountian too.
      void addMountainToClimber(int climberIndex)
      Adds a new mountain to a climber.
      void highestAverage()
      Prints the name of the climber who has recorded the highest average mountian height to the console as well as thier average climbed height (m)
      void highestMountain()
      Prints the name and height of the highest mountain recorded by a member of the club to the console
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method which creates a ClubStats object and runs the program by invoking the start method within that object
      void mountainsHigherThan(int levelAbove)
      Prints a list of mountains which club members have climbed that are higher than a specified value.
      void start()
      This method provides the functioning of the menu system which allows the user to add new climbers to the club, add new mountains to these climbers and view statstics about the club by calling other methods in this class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClubStats

        public ClubStats()
        Constructor method for Club Stats.

    • Method Detail

      • addClimber

        public void addClimber()
        Allows the user to create a new Climber which will be added to the club by specifying their name, gender and age. These paramaters are passed to the Climber constructor to create a new climber which is then added to the list of climbers in the club. This method also provides a fast way to add a new mountian to the climber which has just been created

      • addMountain

        public void addMountain()
        Presents the user with a list of climbers (ordered by their index value in the climber list array) so they can select which one they would like to add a new mountian too. This index value is then passed to the addMountainToClimber method

      • addMountainToClimber

        public void addMountainToClimber(int climberIndex)
        Adds a new mountain to a climber. This method asks the user for the name and height of a new mountain. These paramaters are then passed to the Mountain constructor to create a new mountian object. This object is then added to the list of climbed mountains for the climber who resides at the specified index position in the cilmbers list array
        Parameters:
        climberIndex - The index position of the climber in the climbers list array

      • highestAverage

        public void highestAverage()
        Prints the name of the climber who has recorded the highest average mountian height to the console as well as thier average climbed height (m)

      • highestMountain

        public void highestMountain()
        Prints the name and height of the highest mountain recorded by a member of the club to the console

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method which creates a ClubStats object and runs the program by invoking the start method within that object

      • mountainsHigherThan

        public void mountainsHigherThan(int levelAbove)
        Prints a list of mountains which club members have climbed that are higher than a specified value.
        Parameters:
        levelAbove - The height (m) a mountain must be taller than to appear in the list

      • start

        public void start()
        This method provides the functioning of the menu system which allows the user to add new climbers to the club, add new mountains to these climbers and view statstics about the club by calling other methods in this class. It also provides the user with a way to terminate the program with an 'exit' command.
